page.title: 02Housing in South Wakefield
page.content: The northern part of our area, which is nearer to Wakefield, has many types of housing of many ages. The Kettlethorpe Estate covers a square kilometre and is very much typical of any council estate - composed mainly of semi-detached houses. There are many open spaces but little in the way of amenities. The Pledwick area contains post-war housing much of it detached and high priced. This area developed to cater for the needs of those who wanted to live in pleasant surroundings but have good access to the major towns and cities of West Yorkshire and South Yorkshire. Newmillerdam alone maintains its old charm and character although there has been some development here also. At one time houses in this area were isolated. Many remain run down.
